page.title: 19A day in the life of Joanna.
page.content: My day begins at 7.30 a.m. when I get up, dress and have my breakfast of cornflakes and toast. At 8.45 a.m. I walk to school. I play with my friends until 9.00 a.m. when a whistle blows for us to go in to assembly where we sing and say prayers together. After assembly we write stories, practice handwriting or do maths. Some days we watch television programmes connected with our work. At 12.00 mid-day we have lunch in the village hall. Some children have school dinners, some bring sandwiches and others go home. After lunch we have games, art, storytime, or music or we work on an interest topic. At 3.30 p.m. we finish and go home. During the evening I play with my friends and have my tea. At about 9.00 p.m. I have a bath and go to bed.
